faq.a1: Prompt Party is a social network for sharing, discovering, and remixing AI prompts.
faq.a2: Yes! Prompt Party is completely free to use. You can create an account, share prompts, and build collections at no cost.
faq.a3: Yes, when creating a prompt you can choose to make it private. Private prompts are only visible to you.
faq.a4: Remixing allows you to create a new prompt based on an existing one. Your remix will credit the original creator.
faq.a5: Collections let you organize prompts into groups. You can create public collections to share with others, or private collections for personal use.
faq.a6: Prompts support full Markdown including headers, bold/italic text, code blocks, lists, links, and images.
faq.a7: Yes, you can edit or delete your prompts at any time from your profile page.
faq.a8: Trending prompts are calculated based on recent likes and comments, showing you what's popular right now.
faq.contact_text: Contact us or open an issue on our GitHub repository.
faq.page_description: Frequently asked questions about Prompt Party
faq.q3: Can I make my prompts private?
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions

marketing_suite.faq_1_a: Start using Marketing Suite immediately with full access to all features. No credit card required. If you love it (you will), upgrade after 14 days. Otherwise, downgrade to Free with no questions asked.
marketing_suite.faq_1_q: How does the 14-day free trial work?
marketing_suite.faq_2_a: Yes! Upgrade to unlock more features or downgrade if your needs change. Changes take effect immediately, and billing is prorated.
marketing_suite.faq_2_q: Can I upgrade or downgrade anytime?
marketing_suite.faq_3_a: Marketing Suite includes unlimited testing on GPT-4, GPT-3.5, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Claude 3.5 Haiku, Gemini 1.5 Pro, and Gemini 1.5 Flash. Compare results side-by-side.
marketing_suite.faq_4_a: Invite up to 2 additional team members or clients. Share collections, collaborate on prompts, and manage permissions. Perfect for agencies working with clients.
marketing_suite.faq_4_q: How does the Mini-Team feature work?
marketing_suite.faq_5_a: Yes! 14-day money-back guarantee, no questions asked. If Marketing Suite doesn't save you 10+ hours in the first 2 weeks, we'll refund 100%.
marketing_suite.faq_6_a: Absolutely! All prompts and AI outputs can be used for commercial purposes. Create content for your business or clients without restrictions.
marketing_suite.feature_analytics_desc: Track prompt performance, A/B test results, and ROI. Export PDF reports for clients.
marketing_suite.feature_brand_desc: Train AI on your brand style. Get consistent, on-brand content every time.
marketing_suite.feature_library_desc: Pre-tested prompts for copywriting, SEO, social media, ads, and email marketing
marketing_suite.feature_support_desc: <2h response time + 12 masterclasses/year on advanced AI marketing strategies.
marketing_suite.feature_team_desc: Collaborate with clients or colleagues. Share collections and prompts seamlessly.
marketing_suite.feature_testing_desc: Test prompts on GPT-4, Claude 3.5, and Gemini simultaneously. Compare results instantly.
marketing_suite.features_subtitle: Stop juggling multiple tools. Get everything you need to create world-class marketing content.
marketing_suite.features_title: Professional Marketing Tools in One Suite
marketing_suite.final_cta_features: ‚úì No credit card required  ‚Ä¢  ‚úì 14-day free trial  ‚Ä¢  ‚úì Cancel anytime
marketing_suite.final_cta_subtitle: Join 1,000+ marketers who save 10+ hours per week with Marketing Suite. Start your 14-day free trial today.
marketing_suite.hero_no_card: No credit card required ‚Ä¢ Cancel anytime ‚Ä¢ 14-day money-back guarantee

mcp_integration.what_is_mcp_text: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables AI models and assistants to securely access external data sources and tools. Prompt Party's MCP endpoint provides structured access to our prompt library, allowing AI assistants to discover, search, and retrieve prompts programmatically.

faq.answer_1: Yes. All courses, tutorials, tools, and core features remain 100% free, with no time limit. That's our commitment.
faq.answer_2: Of course! You can cancel anytime, no commitment. You keep your benefits until the end of your current month.
faq.answer_3: Yes! Share the platform, contribute prompts, help in the forum, or make a one-time donation. Every contribution counts.
faq.answer_4: Nothing changes! Everything remains free and accessible. Support is 100% optional and doesn't affect access to educational content.
faq.question_3: Are there other ways to support?

why_support.reason_1_description: Your support allows us to keep all courses, tutorials, and tools 100% free for everyone, without ads.
why_support.reason_2_description: We invest in new learning paths, video tutorials, webinars, and tools for the community.
why_support.reason_3_description: We simplify AI in French to make it accessible to everyone, without language or price barriers.
why_support.reason_4_description: Servers, development tools, API integrations - all of this has a cost that your support covers.
why_support.title: Why your support matters

pricing_full.cta_subtitle: Join thousands of prompt engineers building the future of AI
pricing_full.faq_1_a: AI tests let you run your prompts against GPT-4, Claude, or Gemini to see results before sharing. Free users get 10 per month, Pro users get unlimited.
pricing_full.faq_2_a: Yes! Upgrade instantly, downgrade at the end of your billing cycle. No long-term commitments.
pricing_full.faq_2_q: Can I upgrade or downgrade anytime?
pricing_full.faq_3_a: We offer a 14-day money-back guarantee on all paid plans. No questions asked.
pricing_full.faq_4_a: Team plans are billed monthly at $29 for up to 10 members. Need more seats? Contact us for custom pricing.
pricing_full.faq_5_a: Yes! Pay annually and get 2 months free (16% discount). Switch to annual billing in your account settings.
pricing_full.subtitle: Start free, upgrade when you're ready. All plans include access to our community.
pricing_full.title: Choose Your Plan

privacy.changes_text: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page.
privacy.contact_text: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us through our GitHub repository.
privacy.cookies_text: We use cookies and similar technologies to maintain your session and improve your experience. You can control cookies through your browser settings.
privacy.data_storage_text: Your data is stored securely using Supabase (PostgreSQL) with encryption at rest. We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your information.
privacy.how_use_3: Communicate with you about updates and features
privacy.how_use_text: We use the information we collect to:
privacy.info_collect_text: When you use Prompt Party, we collect information that you provide directly to us, including:
privacy.sharing_text: We do not sell your personal information. Public content you create (public prompts, comments) is visible to other users. Private prompts and collections remain private.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy

terms.acceptance_text: By accessing and using Prompt Party, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provision of this agreement.
terms.accounts_text: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and password. You agree to accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account.
terms.changes_text: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will notify users of significant changes via email or platform notification.
terms.contact_text: For questions about these terms, please contact us through our GitHub repository.
terms.content_text: You retain ownership of content you create on Prompt Party. By posting content, you grant us a non-exclusive license to use, display, and distribute your content on the platform.
terms.disclaimer_text: Prompt Party is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. We do not guarantee the accuracy, reliability, or availability of the service.
terms.intellectual_text: When you remix a prompt, you must credit the original creator. We respect intellectual property rights and expect users to do the same.
terms.liability_text: We shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use of the service.
terms.moderation_text: We reserve the right to remove content and suspend accounts that violate these terms or our community guidelines.
terms.termination_text: We may terminate or suspend your account at any time for violation of these terms. You may delete your account at any time through your profile settings.
terms.title: Terms of Service

advanced_prompting.constraints_intro: Constraints can paradoxically improve creativity and output quality:
advanced_prompting.cot_intro: Chain-of-thought prompting encourages the AI to show its reasoning process step-by-step, leading to more accurate and explainable results.
advanced_prompting.few_shot_intro: Provide examples of the desired input-output pattern to guide the AI's responses.
advanced_prompting.few_shot_pattern_desc: Show 2-3 examples before your actual request
advanced_prompting.few_shot_tip: 2-5 examples usually work best. Too few and the pattern isn't clear. Too many and you waste tokens!
advanced_prompting.meta_prompting_intro: Ask the AI to help you create or improve prompts. The AI becomes your prompting assistant!
advanced_prompting.page_description: Learn chain-of-thought, few-shot learning, role-based prompting and other advanced techniques.
advanced_prompting.page_title: Advanced Prompting Techniques | Tutorials | Prompt Party
advanced_prompting.practice_hint: Hint: Try combining role-based prompting + few-shot examples + constraints!
advanced_prompting.practice_intro: Combine at least 3 techniques from this tutorial to create a prompt for:
advanced_prompting.practice_task: Create a product description for a new smartphone that appeals to both tech enthusiasts and casual users.
advanced_prompting.refinement_step_3_desc: "This is good, but could you also..."
advanced_prompting.role_prompting_intro: Assign a specific role or persona to the AI to get responses aligned with that perspective and expertise.
advanced_prompting.subtitle: Master chain-of-thought, few-shot learning, role-based prompting, and more.
advanced_prompting.title: Advanced Prompting Techniques
advanced_prompting.with_cot_desc: Clear reasoning process. Easy to verify and understand.
advanced_prompting.without_cot_desc: Direct answer without explanation. Harder to verify or learn from.

claudeAgents.advanced_error_handling_description: Tools should return errors that Claude can understand:
claudeAgents.advanced_multi_step_description: Guide the agent to break down complex tasks into steps:
claudeAgents.agent_loop_description: The agent runs in a loop until task completion
claudeAgents.alert_input_schema: The input_schema tells Claude exactly what parameters the tool accepts. Be specific in your descriptions!
claudeAgents.best_practices_do5: ‚úÖ Set max iteration limits to prevent infinite loops
claudeAgents.best_practices_dont1: ‚ùå Don't give tools access to dangerous operations without safeguards
claudeAgents.best_practices_dont2: ‚ùå Don't rely on the agent to validate its own permissions
claudeAgents.best_practices_dont3: ‚ùå Don't return unstructured or ambiguous tool results
claudeAgents.best_practices_dont4: ‚ùå Don't create tools that modify critical data without confirmation
claudeAgents.best_practices_dont5: ‚ùå Don't skip error handling in tool implementations
claudeAgents.description: Create intelligent agents with Claude that can perform complex tasks autonomously using tool use and function calling.
claudeAgents.example_card_description: An agent that can search, analyze, and synthesize information
claudeAgents.intro_capability5: Make decisions based on intermediate results
claudeAgents.intro_para1: Claude agents are autonomous AI assistants that can use tools and make decisions to accomplish complex tasks. Unlike simple chat interactions, agents can:
claudeAgents.intro_para2: The key to building effective agents is tool use (also called function calling). This allows Claude to interact with the outside world beyond just generating text.
claudeAgents.learn_best_practices: Best practices for agent design and safety
claudeAgents.learn_defining_tools: Defining and implementing tools for Claude
claudeAgents.page_description: Learn how to create intelligent Claude AI agents that can perform complex tasks autonomously with tool use and function calling.
claudeAgents.page_title: Building Claude Agents | Tutorials | Prompt Party
claudeAgents.title: Building Claude Agents
claudeAgents.tool_defining_description: Tools are functions Claude can call to perform actions
claudeAgents.tool_functions_description: Map tool names to actual implementations

claude_basics.avoid_5: Expecting Claude to access external links
claude_basics.between_desc: Each new conversation starts fresh. Claude doesn't remember previous conversations, so you'll need to provide context again if you're continuing work from a previous session.
claude_basics.claude_intro: Claude is an AI assistant created by Anthropic. It's designed to be helpful, harmless, and honest. Claude can assist with a wide variety of tasks:
claude_basics.context_tip: If you're working on a long-term project, save important context and paste it at the start of new conversations!
claude_basics.large_context_desc: Claude can process up to 200,000 tokens (~150,000 words) at once. This means you can:
claude_basics.learn_conversations: How to have effective conversations with Claude
claude_basics.learn_practices: Best practices for getting great results
claude_basics.learn_unique: What makes Claude unique and powerful
claude_basics.page_description: Discover Claude AI capabilities and learn how to interact with it effectively for various tasks.
claude_basics.page_title: Getting Started with Claude | Tutorials | Prompt Party
claude_basics.reasoning_desc: Claude excels at complex reasoning tasks, step-by-step problem solving, and understanding nuanced instructions.
claude_basics.safety_desc: Claude is trained to be helpful, harmless, and honest. It avoids generating harmful content and admits when it doesn't know something rather than making things up.
claude_basics.subtitle: Discover Claude AI capabilities and learn how to interact with it effectively.
claude_basics.tip_text: Talk to Claude like you would to a knowledgeable colleague. Be clear, provide context, and ask follow-up questions!
claude_basics.title: Getting Started with Claude
claude_basics.too_vague: Too vague - Claude will need to ask many clarifying questions about your tech stack, use case, and requirements.
claude_basics.try_wizard: Try the Prompt Wizard for guided prompt creation
claude_basics.will_1: Understand your tech stack (React, Next.js 14, App Router)
claude_basics.will_3: Offer code examples specific to your setup
claude_basics.will_4: Suggest best practices and security considerations
claude_basics.within_desc: Claude remembers everything you've discussed in the current conversation. You can refer back to previous messages, ask follow-up questions, and build on earlier topics.

code_generation.continue_2: ‚Ä¢ Share your best prompts in the
code_generation.debug_pro_tip: Pro Tip: Include the full error stack trace and relevant environment info (Node version, browser, etc.)

code_generation.title: AI Code Generation & Review
code_generation.translation_example_desc: "Convert this Python data processing script to Rust. Use appropriate error handling with Result types and leverage Rust's ownership system for memory safety."
code_generation.vague_problem: Too vague - what language? What validation rules? Error handling?

intro_prompts.anatomy_subtitle: Every Good Prompt Has These Elements:
intro_prompts.anatomy_title: The Anatomy of a Good Prompt
intro_prompts.element_constraints_desc: Limitations or requirements for the output.
intro_prompts.element_constraints_example: Keep it under 150 words, professional tone, mention React and Node.js.
intro_prompts.element_context_desc: Background information that helps the AI understand the situation.
intro_prompts.element_context_example: I'm a freelance web developer with 5 years of experience...
intro_prompts.element_format_desc: How you want the output structured.
intro_prompts.element_format_example: Format as 3 paragraphs: intro, skills, call to action.
intro_prompts.element_task_desc: What you want the AI to do.
intro_prompts.element_task_example: Write a professional bio for my portfolio website.
intro_prompts.exercise1_hint: Think: What specific section? What industry? What format?
intro_prompts.exercise1_prompt: Help me with my business plan.
intro_prompts.exercise2_hint: Think: What language? What should it do? What are you looking for?
intro_prompts.exercise3_hint: Think: Split into separate, focused prompts
intro_prompts.exercise3_prompt: Write an email to my boss, create a todo list for tomorrow, and explain blockchain.
intro_prompts.keep_learning_wizard: Try the <link>Prompt Wizard</link> for guided creation
intro_prompts.learn_anatomy: The anatomy of an effective prompt
intro_prompts.learn_what_is: What is a prompt and why it matters
intro_prompts.mistake1_good: Write HTML and CSS code for a responsive landing page with a hero section, features grid (3 columns), and contact form. Use modern design with a blue color scheme.
intro_prompts.mistake2_good:
Make this more casual, like these examples:

Formal: "We would appreciate your feedback."
Casual: "We'd love to hear what you think!"

Formal: "Please contact us at your earliest convenience."
Casual: "Feel free to reach out anytime!"
intro_prompts.mistake3_bad: Explain quantum physics, write a poem about cats, and give me 5 healthy recipes.
intro_prompts.mistake3_good: Explain quantum physics at a high school level, using everyday analogies.
intro_prompts.mistake3_note: Then ask the other questions separately.
intro_prompts.page_description: Learn the fundamentals of crafting effective prompts for AI models like Claude, ChatGPT, and more.
intro_prompts.page_title: Introduction to AI Prompts | Tutorials | Prompt Party
intro_prompts.pro_tip: Pro Tip: Not every prompt needs all four elements! Simple questions might only need a task. Complex requests benefit from all four.
intro_prompts.specific_description: Clear goal, context, and target audience specified.
intro_prompts.specific_example: Create a 3-month social media marketing plan for a new coffee shop targeting young professionals.
intro_prompts.subtitle: Learn the fundamentals of crafting effective prompts for AI models like Claude, ChatGPT, and more.
intro_prompts.template_analysis_code:
Analyze [TOPIC/DATA/SITUATION].

Focus on:
1. [ASPECT 1]
2. [ASPECT 2]
3. [ASPECT 3]

Provide:
- Key insights
- Potential issues
- Recommendations
intro_prompts.template_code_code:
Write [LANGUAGE] code for [FUNCTIONALITY].

Requirements:
- [REQUIREMENT 1]
- [REQUIREMENT 2]

Constraints:
- [CONSTRAINT 1]
- [CONSTRAINT 2]

Include comments explaining the logic.
intro_prompts.template_learning_code:
Explain [CONCEPT] at a [LEVEL] level.

Use:
- Simple language
- Real-world examples
- Step-by-step breakdown

Avoid jargon unless explained.
intro_prompts.template_writing_code:
Write a [TYPE OF CONTENT] about [TOPIC].

Audience: [WHO IS READING THIS]
Tone: [FORMAL/CASUAL/FRIENDLY/ETC]
Length: [WORD COUNT OR TIME]
Key points to include:
- [POINT 1]
- [POINT 2]
- [POINT 3]

Format: [HOW TO STRUCTURE]
intro_prompts.title: Introduction to AI Prompts
intro_prompts.vague_description: Too broad - the AI doesn't know what aspect of marketing you care about.
intro_prompts.what_is_prompt_intro: A prompt is the instruction or question you give to an AI model. Think of it as having a conversation with a very knowledgeable assistant who can help with almost anything - but you need to be clear about what you want!

multi_agent_systems.do_1: ‚úì Give each agent a clear, specific role
multi_agent_systems.interface_1_desc: Make agents output in predictable formats:
multi_agent_systems.interface_1_example: Agent prompt: "Return results as JSON with fields: summary, confidence, next_steps"
multi_agent_systems.interface_2_desc: Explicitly state what the next agent needs:
multi_agent_systems.intro: A multi-agent system consists of multiple specialized AI agents working together to solve complex problems that a single agent couldn't handle as effectively.
multi_agent_systems.page_description: Build complex systems with multiple AI agents working together to solve advanced problems.
multi_agent_systems.pattern_1_desc: Agents work in a linear sequence, each processing the previous agent's output
multi_agent_systems.pattern_2_desc: Multiple agents work simultaneously, then results are combined
multi_agent_systems.pattern_3_desc: Agents critique and improve each other's work in cycles
multi_agent_systems.pattern_4_desc: A coordinator agent manages and delegates to specialized workers
multi_agent_systems.real_world_intro: A complete multi-agent system for creating high-quality blog posts:
multi_agent_systems.result_message: Result: High-quality content in 1-2 minutes that would take a human 2-3 hours!
multi_agent_systems.single_1: Jack of all trades, master of none
multi_agent_systems.single_desc: One agent tries to do everything:
multi_agent_systems.subtitle: Build complex systems with multiple AI agents working together.
multi_agent_systems.title: Multi-Agent Systems

pro_path.prereq_text: This professional path assumes you have:
pro_path.professional_text: This path focuses on skills needed for professional prompt engineering:
pro_path.progress_message: Become a professional prompt engineer and build production systems!

prompt_optimization.batching_alert: Batching can reduce costs by 80%+ and dramatically speed up processing!
prompt_optimization.caching_best_for: Best for: Large context (docs, codebases) that you query multiple times
prompt_optimization.caching_intro: Claude can cache parts of your prompt that don't change, reducing costs by ~90% for cached content and speeding up responses.
prompt_optimization.caching_practice_1: ‚úì Put static content (docs, guidelines) at the start
prompt_optimization.caching_practice_2: ‚úì Variable content (queries, data) at the end
prompt_optimization.caching_practice_3: ‚úì Use caching for documents you reference repeatedly
prompt_optimization.caching_practice_4: ‚úì Cache expires after 5 minutes of inactivity
prompt_optimization.checklist_1: Remove unnecessary pleasantries and filler words
prompt_optimization.checklist_2: Specify exact output format and length
prompt_optimization.concise_tips:
Add to prompts:
"Be concise. One sentence per point."
"Use bullet points, not paragraphs."
"Explain like I'm 5."
prompt_optimization.cost_desc: Fewer tokens = lower API costs. Optimization can reduce costs by 50-80%.
prompt_optimization.edge_case_example:
Analyze the sentiment of this review.

If the review is empty or unclear, respond with: "INSUFFICIENT_DATA"
Otherwise, respond with: POSITIVE, NEGATIVE, or NEUTRAL
prompt_optimization.format_constraints_example:
Instead of: "List the main points"

Use: "Create a markdown table with 2 columns: Point, Impact. Max 5 rows."
prompt_optimization.learn_reduce: How to reduce token usage and costs
prompt_optimization.output_format_good: Good: "Return as JSON with fields: name, age, role"
prompt_optimization.page_description: Learn techniques to make your prompts faster, cheaper, and more reliable.
prompt_optimization.page_title: Optimizing Prompts for Performance | Tutorials | Prompt Party
prompt_optimization.reliability_desc: Clearer, optimized prompts produce more consistent results.
prompt_optimization.speed_desc: Shorter prompts and responses mean faster turnaround times.
prompt_optimization.strategy_extract_example: Instead of "Analyze this document", ask "Extract the 5 main action items from this document"
prompt_optimization.strategy_output_length_example: "Summarize in 3 sentences" prevents unnecessarily long responses
prompt_optimization.strategy_redundant_example: "Please help me" ‚Üí "Help:" or just start with the request
prompt_optimization.subtitle: Techniques to make your prompts faster, cheaper, and more reliable.
prompt_optimization.title: Optimizing Prompts for Performance
prompt_optimization.token_waste_example: ~45 tokens of fluff before getting to the point
prompt_optimization.tokens_alert: Both your prompt AND the response count toward token usage and cost!
prompt_optimization.tokens_intro: Tokens are pieces of words. On average: 1 token ‚âà 4 characters or ¬æ of a word.
prompt_optimization.validation_example:
Extract email addresses from this text.

Validate that each email:
- Contains @ symbol
- Has a domain name
- Follows standard format

Return only valid emails, one per line.

prompt_templates.anatomy_1_desc: Start with what you want the AI to do
prompt_templates.anatomy_2_desc: Use clear, descriptive placeholders for variable content
prompt_templates.anatomy_3_desc: Include relevant context and any limitations
prompt_templates.anatomy_4_desc: Specify how you want the response structured
prompt_templates.challenge_text: Save your best templates to the Prompt Party library to share with the community!
prompt_templates.code_review_desc: For reviewing code quality and suggesting improvements
prompt_templates.conditional_desc: Include optional sections based on your needs:
prompt_templates.content_summary_desc: For summarizing articles, documents, or meetings
prompt_templates.domain_desc: Include industry-specific terminology, standards, or requirements relevant to your field.
prompt_templates.email_desc: For business emails, client communications, etc.

prompt_templates.learn_customize: How to customize and combine templates
prompt_templates.learn_what: What prompt templates are and why they're powerful
prompt_templates.mix_match_desc: Combine elements from different templates to create exactly what you need.
prompt_templates.nested_desc: Create templates within templates for complex, multi-part tasks:
prompt_templates.page_description: Master the art of reusable prompt templates for common tasks and boost your productivity.
prompt_templates.page_title: Using Prompt Templates | Tutorials | Prompt Party
prompt_templates.placeholder_tip: Use UPPERCASE or [BRACKETS] for placeholders so they're easy to spot and replace!
prompt_templates.practice_text: Think of a task you do regularly. Create a template for it using these steps:
prompt_templates.problem_solving_desc: For systematic problem analysis and solutions
prompt_templates.save_desc: Keep a personal library of templates that work well for you. Refine them over time.
prompt_templates.share_desc: Create team-specific templates for consistent communication and output quality.

prompt_templates.step_1: Identify the parts that stay the same every time
prompt_templates.step_4: Specify the output format you want
prompt_templates.subtitle: Master the art of reusable prompt templates to boost your productivity and consistency.
prompt_templates.template_intro: A prompt template is a reusable structure for creating prompts. Instead of writing from scratch every time, you fill in placeholders with specific details.
prompt_templates.title: Using Prompt Templates
prompt_templates.variables_desc: Provide default values to speed up template usage:
prompt_templates.with_desc: Fill in the blanks and get consistent, high-quality results:
prompt_templates.without_desc: Every time you need something similar, you start from scratch:

interactiveTutorial.title: Interactive Prompt Builder
interactiveTutorial.description: Try different prompting techniques and see how they work
interactiveTutorial.writePromptPlaceholder: Try writing your own prompt here...
interactiveTutorial.tip1: Be specific and clear about what you want
interactiveTutorial.tip4: Ask the AI to think step-by-step for complex tasks
interactiveTutorial.tip5: Define the role or expertise level you need
interactiveTutorial.tip6: Specify the format of the output you want

basic.title: Basic Instruction
basic.prompt: Write a professional email to schedule a meeting with a client.
basic.explanation: Direct, clear instruction with a specific task.

roleBased.title: Role-Based Prompting
roleBased.prompt: You are an expert software architect. Design a scalable microservices architecture for an e-commerce platform. Consider: load balancing, database sharding, caching strategy, and API gateway.
roleBased.explanation: Assigns a role to the AI and provides specific requirements.

chainOfThought.title: Chain-of-Thought
chainOfThought.prompt:
A train travels at 60 km/h and needs to cover 180 km. How long will it take?

Think step by step:
1. Identify the formula
2. Plug in the values
3. Calculate the result
4. Verify your answer
chainOfThought.explanation: Guides the AI to break down the problem into steps.

fewShot.title: Few-Shot Learning
fewShot.prompt:
Convert these sentences to questions:

Sentence: The cat is sleeping.
Question: Is the cat sleeping?

Sentence: They went to the park.
Question: Did they go to the park?

Sentence: She enjoys reading books.
Question:
fewShot.explanation: Provides examples to teach the AI the pattern.

tutorials.quiz_validation_description: R√©ponds correctement √† toutes les questions pour valider cette le√ßon
tutorials.quiz_correct_answers: Tu as r√©pondu correctement aux {totalQuestions} questions !
tutorials.quiz_partial_answers: {score}/{totalQuestions} bonnes r√©ponses. R√©essaie pour valider la le√ßon.

wizard.additional_context_placeholder: Ex: Target audience is e-commerce entrepreneurs with limited budgets
wizard.assistant_example: Assistant: "Here's a 3-pillar strategy: 1) Visual storytelling... 2) Community engagement..."
wizard.assistant_example_hint: üí° Provide a concrete example of the desired format/style of response
wizard.assistant_example_placeholder:
Ex: Instagram Strategy for Artisan Caf√©

üéØ Pillar 1: Behind the scenes
- Show roasting process
- Producer portraits
...
wizard.assistant_when: To provide examples of the desired response format or style. Improves consistency.
wizard.best_practice_1: Use clear action verbs (Create, Analyze, List, Generate...)
wizard.best_practice_2: Specify expected length (word count, points, sections...)
wizard.best_practice_3: Provide a concrete example if the format is complex
wizard.chatgpt_desc: OpenAI's conversational AI, excellent for general tasks
wizard.chatgpt_style: Clear instructions with context. Responds well to role-play and structured formats.
wizard.claude_desc: Anthropic's helpful, harmless, and honest assistant
wizard.claude_style: Detailed explanations work best. Excels with step-by-step reasoning and nuanced tasks.
wizard.description: Create perfectly optimized prompts for ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini and more. Understand the differences between system, user and assistant prompts.
wizard.gemini_style: Natural language with clear goals. Works well with contextual information.
wizard.llama_style: Direct and specific. Benefits from explicit formatting instructions.
wizard.output_format_placeholder: Ex: Bullet list, table, JSON, paragraph...
wizard.pro_tip_text: For best results, combine all 3 types: System defines the role, User asks the question, Assistant shows an example response. This approach ensures consistent and accurate responses.
wizard.step1_heading: Which AI model will you use?
wizard.step1_subtitle: Each AI has its strengths. Choose the one that matches your need.
wizard.step1_title: What do you want to create?
wizard.step2_subtitle: The 3 key elements for creating a high-performing prompt
wizard.step3_subtitle: Establish the AI's role and behavior
wizard.step4_subtitle: The specific question or task you want to accomplish
wizard.system_desc: Defines the overall behavior and role of the AI
wizard.system_example: You are a digital marketing expert with 10 years of experience. You provide practical, actionable advice.
wizard.system_prompt_hint: üí° Include: expertise, tone, response style, constraints
wizard.system_prompt_placeholder: Ex: You are a digital marketing expert with 10 years of experience. You provide practical, data-driven advice tailored to SMBs. Your tone is professional yet accessible.
wizard.system_when: To establish context, tone, constraints, and the AI's role. This is the baseline 'personality'.
wizard.title: Optimized Prompt Creator
wizard.user_example: Create an Instagram content strategy for an artisan coffee brand
wizard.user_prompt_hint: üí° Be specific: what, why, expected format
wizard.user_prompt_placeholder: Ex: Create an Instagram content strategy for an artisan coffee brand. Include 3 content pillars and 10 post ideas.
wizard.user_when: To ask your specific question or request a precise task. This is your input.
